data.text: Okay so uh… I already took like five trades this morning and it's not even 10am. None of them were really there but I was just… bored, you know? I keep clicking in and out, spreads are killing me but I feel like if I stop I'm gonna miss something.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: Man I was up like, what, 2R on that move and I just closed it. I couldn't watch it pull back even a little. Now it's ripping without me. I hate that I do this, I just wanted the green locked in.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: This is such BS. That stop was perfect and it still tagged me. Whatever, screw it, I'm going back in double size. Market owes me after that garbage wick.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Everyone on Twitter is screaming this thing is gonna moon. Like literally everyone. I don't even see the setup but if I don't ape in now I'm gonna feel like an idiot watching it rip.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: Okay so that's three losers in a row which means statistically the next one should hit, right? I mean it has to. I'm just gonna size up a bit and let probability do its thing.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Uh… price is kind of just chopping but I keep jumping in for these tiny scalps. I tell myself it's practice but honestly I just like being in a trade. Flat days make me itchy.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I'm still holding this red position. It's down way more than I planned but if I close it now it's real. Maybe it'll bounce back to VWAP, I just… I don't wanna take the loss.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: No no no, that's it, I'm pissed now. First trade rekt me, second one slipped, and now I'm slamming the buy button. I don't even care about the setup, I just need to make it back today.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Chat's going crazy about this breakout and I feel late already. I know chasing is bad but like, what if this is the one that runs all day and I'm sitting here doing nothing?
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I've been trading for years, I know better than this, but after all these losses it just feels like a win is due. The system wouldn't screw me this many times in a row… right?
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I said I was done for the day but I keep seeing these little moves and I'm like, oh that's tradable, that's tradable too. Next thing I know I'm on trade number nine and my P/L is basically zero.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: Uh… I had my finger on the buy button and then it started moving and I froze. Now it's already up two percent. I just didn't want to be wrong again.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: This market is straight up rigged. Took my stop to the tick and reversed. I'm not walking away like that. I'm loading back in heavier, no stop this time.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Everyone in Discord is already green on this trade and I'm sitting here flat. I know it's extended but I can't just watch them print while I do nothing.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: Four red trades… okay statistically that just doesn't make sense. The next one basically has to be a winner so I'm gonna push size a bit.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I keep telling myself I'm just managing risk but really I'm just clicking buttons. Even the commissions are stacking up. I'm trading just to feel active.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I moved my stop lower again. I know that's bad but if I get stopped here it'll ruin the whole week. I'll give it a little more room.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Nah I'm not calming down. That loss was personal. I'm going right back in on the same ticker. Bigger size. I don't care anymore.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: This thing is all over Reddit right now. I don't even know what the company does but people are saying squeeze so… yeah I'm in.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I mean eventually the odds have to flip. Losing this many times in a row just isn't normal. Next trade should balance it out.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Market's slow but I'm forcing scalps on the one-minute. Half-cent wins, half-cent losses, just nonstop clicking.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I sold way too early again. As soon as it went green I panicked and took it. Now it's doing exactly what I planned originally.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: I'm so mad right now I can barely think. That trade wiped my morning and I'm just smashing hotkeys trying to get it back.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: This breakout already happened but people are saying second leg. I don't wanna be the only one not in when it moons.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: After six losers there's basically no way the seventh loses too. That's just math, right? I'm going all in on this setup.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I told myself max three trades today but I'm already at seven and the day just started. I keep finding reasons to enter.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I'm watching this winner pull back and my heart's racing. I know it could go higher but I just want out before it turns red.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: That's it, I'm tilted. I don't care about rules right now. I need a win and I'm gonna force one.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Everyone keeps posting screenshots of insane gains on this ticker. I feel stupid sitting cash while they get rich.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I've lost so many in a row that a win is basically guaranteed now. The market owes me one.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I'm not even waiting for confirmations anymore. If price twitches I jump in. Sitting on my hands feels worse than losing.

data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I moved my take profit closer because being up feels good and I don't want to risk giving that back.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: I feel personally attacked by this chart. I'm going right back in just to prove I'm right.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.label: FOMO

data.text: I've paid my dues with losses. The next trade is basically destiny at this point.

data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.label: FOMO

data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I'm basically scalping noise at this point. Entry, exit, entry, exit, all dopamine no edge.
data.label: Overtrading

data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I closed the platform and reopened it five minutes later because I felt like I might miss a setup.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: If I close this loser now it'll ruin my stats. I'll just wait a bit longer and see what happens.

data.text: I don't even care about the money right now. I just want to win this trade after that last loss.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.label: FOMO

data.text: The universe owes me a win after today. I'm putting faith in the next trade no matter what.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I keep refreshing the chart like something new is gonna magically appear. Every tiny candle looks like a setup if I stare long enough, so yeah… I'm in again.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I was green and I just dumped it immediately. Didn't even let it breathe. I just really didn't want to see it turn red on me.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: That loss flipped my mood instantly. I slammed another trade right after, bigger size, zero patience. I just wanna punch back.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: This thing is all over StockTwits and my phone won't stop buzzing. I feel like if I don't buy now I'm gonna miss the move of the week.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I've had five red days straight so tomorrow pretty much has to be green. I'm planning to size up because the streak can't last forever.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I said no trading during chop but here I am clicking in and out, getting chopped to death, just because silence feels worse.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I hovered over the sell button forever and just couldn't do it. Taking the loss feels heavier than just holding and hoping.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: I know I'm tilted but I'm still trading. That last loss felt disrespectful and I'm not ending the day like that.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Everyone keeps saying this is an easy long and I'm sitting here second-guessing. I hate being the only one not in.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I've been wrong so many times that being wrong again just seems impossible. The odds have to swing back.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I don't even know what my edge is anymore. I'm just trading every five minutes because being flat makes me anxious.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: As soon as it hit green I closed it. I know the plan said hold but locking profit felt safer.

data.text: That stop-out made me angry enough to re-enter without thinking. Same ticker, same bias, bigger size.

data.text: Increased position size after several consecutive losing trades, expecting the next setup to reverse results.

data.text: Multiple scalps taken on the one-minute chart without a clear higher-timeframe bias. Trades overlapped frequently.

data.text: After an initial loss, executed a follow-up trade on the same setup with no confirmation and larger exposure.

data.text: Continued trading throughout the session despite deteriorating conditions and lack of valid setups.

data.text: Risk exposure increased after multiple losses under the assumption that probability favored a win.

data.text: Trade frequency remained high even as performance deteriorated during the session.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: A losing trade was maintained beyond the original exit criteria in anticipation of a rebound.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: A rapid re-entry followed a stop-out without sufficient analysis.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: A position was taken after a move had already attracted significant participation.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: Decision-making on the next trade relied heavily on the expectation that a streak would end.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Trades were initiated continuously throughout the session regardless of setup quality.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: Profit was taken quickly to avoid uncertainty, despite favorable market conditions.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Subsequent trades increased in urgency following an initial loss.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Entry occurred after observing strong price movement and heightened trader engagement.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: The next trade was approached with increased confidence due to prior unsuccessful attempts.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Market exposure was maintained throughout the day with minimal time spent flat.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: A position was exited early to avoid the discomfort of potential drawdown.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Trading behavior became more aggressive following a loss, with less emphasis on planning.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: A trade was entered based on momentum continuation rather than initial setup conditions.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: The assumption that outcomes would normalize influenced increased risk on the next trade.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Stayed active most of the session, taking multiple marginal setups as price moved sideways. Remaining flat felt unproductive.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: Exited the trade shortly after it turned profitable, preferring to secure a small gain rather than wait through uncertainty.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: A second position was opened quickly after a stop-out, with noticeably higher urgency and size.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Entered after momentum accelerated and attention around the ticker increased, despite the move being extended.

data.text: Position size was adjusted upward after a run of losses, driven by the sense that results should soon improve.

data.text: Several trades were taken back-to-back with limited pause, as waiting for clarity felt uncomfortable.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: Held the position past the planned exit, giving it more room than intended as price moved against it.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Another trade was initiated immediately following a loss, with less emphasis on confirmation.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: Joined the move after repeated strong candles, influenced by visible participation from other traders.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: Approached the next trade with increased confidence simply because several previous attempts had failed.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Trade frequency remained high throughout the day, even as setups became less distinct.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: After taking a loss, trading activity became faster and more aggressive on the same instrument.

data.text: Risk assumptions on the next trade were influenced by the belief that the recent streak was unlikely to continue.

data.text: I kept taking trade after trade today even though nothing really looked perfect. Each setup was small, but I felt like if I didn’t do something I’d miss the chance to make a few pips here or there, and sitting on the sidelines was driving me crazy.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I closed my position way too early even though the trend was still intact. I just didn’t want to see it go red again and lose the small gains I had already locked in.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: After getting stopped out, I jumped back in immediately on the same ticker, and I even increased my position size. I knew it was impulsive, but I felt like I had to get that money back before the market moved on me.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: I entered late on the breakout because everyone on social was talking about it. Even though the candle had already run far, I felt like if I didn’t get in now I’d be missing out on the next leg.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: After a string of losses, I sized up on the next trade. My logic was that I was due for a win and that one trade could make up for the money I lost earlier in the day.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I stayed in front of the screen for hours taking small trades on almost nothing. I knew the setups weren’t perfect, but I hated feeling like I wasn’t doing something productive with my day.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I let a trade run for longer than I planned because I was hoping it would come back. Even though my plan said to cut it, I just couldn’t face realizing the loss yet.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Right after a small loss, I entered another trade on the same stock, bigger than the first. I told myself it made sense because I could fix the loss immediately, even though I knew I wasn’t thinking clearly.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: I bought into a strong move that had already run up because everyone was talking about it and I didn’t want to feel left out. I know the price was high, but the fear of missing out overpowered the setup.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I increased my risk on the next trade after a few losses, reasoning that statistically a win had to happen soon. I felt like if I didn’t act, the losing streak would continue and I’d never recover.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I kept scalping small moves across multiple charts even though nothing really screamed a strong setup. I kept thinking that any small edge could add up if I just kept trading.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I sold a trade after just a minor gain, even though my original target was much higher. I kept worrying it could turn against me and didn’t want to give any of it back.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: After a loss, I immediately placed another trade on the same ticker. I knew it wasn’t ideal, but I wanted to even things out quickly and it felt urgent.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: I entered a trade after seeing momentum pick up and the stock trending everywhere online. Even though the setup wasn’t clean, I felt like I had to get in before the move went too far.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I assumed the next trade would work after losing multiple trades in a row. My logic was that I was overdue for a win, so I felt justified taking more risk.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: I kept taking trades all day, hopping in on setups that were far from perfect. Even though I knew it was reckless, the idea of missing any move made me keep clicking.
data.label: Overtrading

data.text: I exited a winning position too early because I didn’t want the stress of seeing it pull back. Even though my plan said to hold, the uncertainty made me sell.
data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: I re-entered the same market immediately after a stop-out with bigger size. I knew it was emotionally driven, but I wanted to fix the loss and couldn’t wait.
data.label: Revenge_Trading

data.text: I bought into a strong trend after seeing it everywhere on social and news. Even though it was late in the move, I felt like not joining would make me miss the next jump.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: I added more to a trade after several losing attempts. I told myself the odds had to flip and that I couldn’t keep losing forever.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Bought after seeing momentum and chatter online; entry was late but I joined anyway.
data.label: FOMO

data.text: Added to a losing position; felt like the next trade had to work.
data.label: Gamblers_Fallacy

data.text: Kept trading even with weak setups; doing nothing felt worse.
data.label: Overtrading

data.label: Loss_Aversion

data.text: Re-entered after a loss; acted quickly, not thinking much.
